---

Pie chart was still constrained because the legend stayed inside the chart canvas, so even after moving it the actual circle never gained extra width. I reworked the entire block so the pie chart now owns a full-width panel and the legend is rendered separately in HTML.

- `system/training/talent-map.html`
  - Added `.chart-combo`, `.chart-panel`, and legend styling so the pie chart uses a single-column layout on small screens (and 1.3:0.9 split on >1400px). This guarantees the canvas spans the full available width.
  - Wrapped the pie chart in a `chart-panel` that contains the canvas plus a new `<div id="distributionLegend" class="chart-legend">` rendered below the chart.

- `demo/assets/js/nine-box.js`
  - Introduced `categoryColors`/`categoryOrder` to keep color definitions centralized.
  - Disabled the built-in ECharts legend and expanded the pie radius to `['45%','70%']`.
  - Added `renderDistributionLegend()` which populates the new HTML legend with color chips, headcounts, and percentages, so the legend always appears under the chart regardless of cache or browser quirks.

- Docs
  - Updated `system/BUGFIX-v1.7.md` and `system/README.md` to describe the new layout + custom legend approach.

Lint check: `system/training/talent-map.html`, `demo/assets/js/nine-box.js`.

Please hard-refresh (`Cmd+Shift+R`) to ensure the new JS and CSS load. The pie chart should now stretch to the panel width with the legend laid out in a responsive grid beneath it. Let me know if any spacing or copy tweaks are needed.

+ // ç¯©é¸å€™é¸äºº
+ function filterCandidates(searchTerm) {

+         const name = $item.find('.candidate-name').text().toLowerCase();
+         const position = $item.find('.candidate-position').text().toLowerCase();

+         if (name.includes(searchTerm) || position.includes(searchTerm)) {

+     });
+ }
